ezRNAseq
  • Reference

Expressed genes in each cell population

Identification of expressed genes in each cell population. Expressed genes in a given cell population is defined as genes with average expression above a given cutoff.

expressed(x, groups, cutoff = 1)

# S3 method for expressed
summary(object, ...)

Arguments

x
matrix or numeric data frame containing gene expression data. Rows are genes and columns are samples.
groups
a factor containing the group assignement of samples
cutoff
a numeric value specifying the threshold above which a gene is declared as expressed.
object
an object of class expressed
...
additional arguments.

Value

  • expressed() returns an object of class "expressed". Columns are samples or groups and rows are genes. Values can be 1 (if expressed) or 0 (if not expressed).
  • summarize() returns a list containing the following components:
    • exprs_in_all: The number of expressed genes in all groups
    • exprs_in_one: The number of expressed genes in at least one group
    • exprs_in_each: a vector containing the number of genes expressed in each group
    • exprs_in_specific: the number of genes expressed only in specific group

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
